glosses: A random, ordinary person of nondescript quality or identity.
Chosen without regard whether it is good or bad; random, indiscriminate.
Spoken without thinking, often out of place or inappropriate.
as soon as, just after, right after (something happens)

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish اولور اولمز or اولور اولماز (olur olmaz), from compound of olur (“(it)happens; possible, doable”) (3rd person singular simple present positive) + olmaz (“(it) doesn't happen; not possible, not doable”) (3rd person singular simple present negative).
